SEARCH
Package grafiosch.repository

Interface MailSendRecvJpaRepositoryCustom

All Superinterfaces:
BaseRepositoryCustom<MailSendRecv>
All Known Subinterfaces:
MailSendRecvJpaRepository
All Known Implementing Classes:
MailSendRecvJpaRepositoryImpl
public interface MailSendRecvJpaRepositoryCustom extends BaseRepositoryCustom<MailSendRecv>
Custom repository interface for MailSendRecv entities providing additional mail management operations beyond standard JPA repository functionality.

This interface extends BaseRepositoryCustom to provide specialized methods for retrieving, marking, and managing mail messages in the internal mail system.

  • Method Details

    • getMailsByUserOrRole

      MailInboxWithSend getMailsByUserOrRole()
      Retrieves all mail messages for the currently authenticated user, including both direct messages and role-based messages.

      This method returns messages that are:

      • Directly addressed to or from the user
      • Sent to roles that the user belongs to
      • Not marked as hidden or deleted by the user

      The returned object also includes counts of role-based conversation replies to help with UI display and notification management.

      Returns:
      a MailInboxWithSend containing the user's mail messages and conversation reply counts

    • markForRead

      MailSendRecv markForRead(Integer idMailSendRecv)
      Marks a specific mail message as read by the currently authenticated user.

      This method updates the read status in the mail_send_recv_read_del table and returns the message with updated read status information for immediate use in the UI.

      Parameters:
      idMailSendRecv - the unique identifier of the mail message to mark as read
      Returns:
      the MailSendRecv entity with updated read status and role name information attached

    • hideDeleteResource

      void hideDeleteResource(Integer idMailSendRecv)
      Hides or deletes a mail message or conversation thread for the currently authenticated user.

      The behavior depends on the message type and user ownership:

      • One-to-one messages: Physically deleted from the database if the user is the sender or receiver
      • Role-based messages: Marked as hidden/deleted in the mail_send_recv_read_del table (soft delete)
      • Conversation threads: All related messages in the thread are processed according to the above rules

      This method ensures users can only hide/delete messages they have access to, providing appropriate security checks.

      Parameters:
      idMailSendRecv - the unique identifier of the mail message or conversation thread to hide/delete
      Throws:
      SecurityException - if the user attempts to delete a message they don't have access to
